oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ordinance Outlawing Mixed Marriages
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ordinance passed by the provisional government of Alabama banning marriages in the state between white persons and negroes or "mixed blood."

A list of ordinances passed by the provisional government in Alabama at the conclusion of the Civil War was sent to Tennnessee Governor William Brownlow by Alabama's provisional governor Lewis E. Parsons in October 1865.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Alabama. Department of Executive
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Reconstruction (1865-1876); Slavery
Proclamations; Interracial marriage
